content: the april scrunchie by knittingsofi the april scrunchie is a quick little project inspired by the red carnations that became the symbol for the portuguese revolution against fascism it can be done in a day and will spice up any outfit that needs a little pop i achieved a gauge of about 21stst and 28rows over a 10x10cm square washed and blocked using 4mm needles and the yarn held double however considering the garment that is built the gauge is not very important 1 instagram @knittingsofi yarn a retrosaria apresenta super soft 100% wool 287m/50g a 50g ball is enough for one scrunchie note you will need a 4mm needle dpns or a longer circular needle that you can you with the magic loop technique a hair elastic and one other needle smaller than 4mm to keep sts on hold prior information stitch glossary bor beginning of the round co cast om k knit m marker p purl pm place marker sm slip marker st s stitch es yo yarn over beginning of the pattern use jenny s magic cast on to co 20 stitches onto two different sets of needles a total of 40 stitches will be cast on 20 on each set of needles leave one of the set of sts resting and work the other one as follows join the 20 sts to work in the round and pm for bor round 1 *k1 yo pm k1 pm yo* repeat the instructions between ** until bor round 2 *k to m yo sm k1 sm yo* repeat the instructions between ** until bor 2 instagram @knittingsofi repeat round 2 for 5 rounds or until work measures 1cm less than your desired size work 3 rounds of garter stitch p all sts on 1st round k all sts on 2nd round and p all sts on 3rd round and loosely bind off all stitches the first half of your scrunchie is now finished you will now attach your hair elastic and work the second half slip all your resting sts onto the 4mm needle join yarn onto them and work them as follows round 1 *k1 co 1 st with the backwards loop method* repeat the instructions between ** until bor now work as follows round 1 *k1 slip 1 purlwise with yarn in front* repeat the instructions between ** until bor round 2 *slip 1 purlwise with yarn in the back p1* repeat the instructions between ** until bor repeat rounds 1 and 2 once more for a total of two times each round take your spare needle and use it separate the sts onto that needle and the one you have been using that is the 4mm needle will be holding the sts you k in this last
